TITLE: Netflix Taps CBS Sports to Produce Its Christmas NFL Games
SUMMARY: Netflix said it has struck a deal to have CBS Sports produce the two National Football League games the streamer is carrying this Christmas.

TITLE: Algonquin Power to Sell Renewable Energy Business for $2.5 Billion
SUMMARY: Algonquin Power & Utilities has agreed to sell its renewable energy business for $2.5 billion as it transforms into a pure-play regulated utility.

TITLE: Merck Buying Drug Targeting B-Cell Diseases for Up to $1.3 Billion
SUMMARY: Merck has struck a deal worth up to $1.3 billion to buy an investigational drug targeting B-cell associated diseases.

TITLE: Indian EV Maker Ola Electric Jumps in Trading Debut
SUMMARY: Shares of Ola Electric Mobility jumped in their trading debut, reflecting strong investor interest in India’s nascent electric-vehicle market.

TITLE: Luxury Brands Increase Prices in Japan Amid Sales Surge, Yen Weakness
SUMMARY: Some luxury brands are pushing through price increases in Japan, as tourists snapping up high-end goods turn the country into a bright spot for an otherwise downbeat industry.

TITLE: Hargreaves Lansdown Agrees to Takeover by Private-Equity Consortium
SUMMARY: Hargreaves Lansdown has agreed to a takeover offer from a CVC-backed private-equity consortium that values the U.K. retail-investment platform at $6.9 billion.

TITLE: Americans Are Skipping Theme Parks This Summer
SUMMARY: Disney, Six Flags and Universal’s owner reported softer results as consumers pull back—or travel abroad.

TITLE: A Lot Was Riding on This Wind Farm. Then Giant Shards Washed Up in Nantucket.
SUMMARY: The industry was dealt a setback after a turbine blade broke at one of the nation’s largest planned offshore wind farms.

TITLE: Generali Profits Rise Despite Higher Natural-Disaster Costs
SUMMARY: Generali posted slightly higher operating profits and a 20% rise in gross premiums for the first half, after improved life-insurance and asset-management results offset increased natural-disaster costs.

TITLE: Samsung Recalls Over One Million Electric Stoves in U.S.
SUMMARY: Samsung Electronics is recalling more than one million electric stoves in the U.S. following reports of about 250 fires that have injured dozens of people and killed pets.

TITLE: Delta to CrowdStrike: Don't Blame Us for Tech Problems
SUMMARY: The airline says the cybersecurity company is shirking blame for the July outage, which led he carrier to cancel about 7,000 flights.

TITLE: Playboy to Bring Back Print Magazine After Covid Shutdown
SUMMARY: PLBY Group said that it’s relaunching Playboy Magazine with an annual edition that will be released in February 2025, a decision that comes about four years after announcing it would be shut down as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic.

TITLE: Paramount Writes Down Value of Cable-TV Business by $6 Billion and Cuts 2,000 Jobs
SUMMARY: Paramount Global, home of Comedy Central, MTV and Nickelodeon, wrote down the value of its cable-TV networks by nearly $6 billion and cut 15% of its workforce, a day after rival Warner Bros. Discovery reported an even larger write-down.

TITLE: Amazon's $4 Billion Investment in Anthropic Comes Under U.K. Scrutiny
SUMMARY: U.K. antitrust officials are probing whether Amazon’s multibillion-dollar investment in artificial-intelligence company Anthropic poses a threat to competition.

TITLE: Boeing's New CEO Is Hands On. He's Being Handed a Company in Crisis.
SUMMARY: Robert “Kelly” Ortberg will need both strategic vision and an eye for detail as he tries to revamp a manufacturing giant that has been hobbled by production delays, factory flubs and quality lapses.

TITLE: Indeed and Glassdoor Owner Posts Profit Rise
SUMMARY: Recruit Holdings reported a rise in first-quarter net profit, thanks to stronger earnings from its human-resources technology business and other key segments.

TITLE: Supplying Saks Was a Soapmaker's Dream Until He Got a $74 Check
SUMMARY: Saks is an unusual example of a large retailer that has been withholding funds from some luxury brands for months.

TITLE: Allianz Lifts Buyback to €1.5 Billion After Strong Second Quarter
SUMMARY: Allianz increased its planned share buyback for 2024 and maintained its outlook after it reported better-than-expected results for the second quarter.

TITLE: China's Sales of EVs, Hybrids Surpass Conventional Cars in July
SUMMARY: Sales of electric vehicles and hybrids in China surpassed that of internal-combustion-engine cars for the first time ever in July, despite weak overall demand.

TITLE: Zillow Promotes Operating Chief Jeremy Wacksman to Chief Executive Role
SUMMARY: Outgoing CEO and co-founder Rich Barton will remain on Zillow’s board as co-executive chair alongside co-founder Lloyd Frink.
